lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around, roll dice, and play Dungeons and Dragons, while Liam curses at me a few seconds before we start the show to try and throw me off. It's worked once before.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cock goblins.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll probably work again. (laughs) Welcome to the show. So yeah, for the returning friends, thank you for coming, and for new folks, welcome to the chaos.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get the fuck out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll be guests this weekend there, so if any folks are coming out, we'll look forward to seeing you. We'll be flying over bright and early tomorrow morning. Taliesin, you're also--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will be in Phoenix, Arizona at the Amazing Comic Con, and if you follow me on Twitter, @executivegoth, I will actually tell you where I will be at the convention at various times.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you can stalk him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You can stalk me. I'll be very stalkable. E-stalk.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like Santa Tracker, but Taliesin Tracker.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Waldo Tracker. Why has nobody done that yet? Give it some time. Let's see. Also, I guess, tonight we're going to be trying out this new table camera here on the side to give you a separate view of the battle. We can switch around as we're finding our way through the amorphous betterment of our program.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we work in like a Wolf Blizter hologram? Like they have on CNN as well?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll put that on the wish list.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: On the table, next to all the guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If we can have him running through the battlefield, it'll be great.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Just his head, floating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let's see. Also, next week, most of us will be at Wizard World Portland. That's our first Wizard World, you can check out the website for information about our events and signings and tickets and stuff like that, so go check it out, please, we look forward to seeing you guys, and we'll see you up in Portland next weekend. What else do we have going on?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, we have an ongoing relationship with Wyrmwood Gaming, which you can find on the internet. They make beautiful boxes for holding dice and stuff, and if you use the code "critrole," "critrole," you will get free shipping. They have all different kinds of woods, they're lovely. And then also, hey, this is an impromptu announcement, but Kurtis Wiebe just announced on the Twitters, Kurtis Wiebe is the writer for the comic book Rat Queens.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Amazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We all are addicted to it. He works with Tess Fowler, who's the artist right now, and basically their outfit and our outfit are in love, and Kurtis announced on Twitter today that he is going to be shoving Vox Machina in there in some way, somehow, and we're very excited.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're making a cameo appearance in Rat Queens, you guys!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Our first cameo.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I want to be the rat!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) You would, wouldn't you? So stupid excited for that. Can't even. I can't even. It's so dumb. So dumb. Life is dumb. Life is dumb. But yeah. So, we got that going on. I can't think of anything else. If anything else comes up, we'll throw it in there in the mid-break, but in the meantime--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh yeah, I want to give a quick shout-out to my charity of choice, the Pablove Foundation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I talked to them today. Their minds were blown by all the gifts that people have sent in and donations in the name of Critical Role and the Critter community. They didn't quite understand what the Critter community was, but I enlightened them, and they're so jazzed by you guys. And they appreciate not just the donations and gifts, but also, they said that the Critters have been writing long letters and telling great stories and stuff, and they're super excited.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's awesome!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So keep it going to those charities. The Pablove Foundation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, should we go off and do a shout-out of each of our charities?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, go for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: First Place for Youth. I'll have a link up to my Twitter in about five minutes. They help kids get through school, they help kids who are orphaned and having issues get their stuff together and become fabulous teenagers like we need in this world.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do. And of course, Sam is with Pablove Foundation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The Pablove Foundation.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pablove Foundation, which is amazing. I chose the Nature Conservancy. They're great and they protect the lands and the animals that is very important so we can keep having a beautiful green world.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I chose the Planetary Society, just in case the green world dies, and it promotes exploration of space, and the stuff like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I chose My Friend's Place, which is an awesome, very similar to Taliesin's, it's an awesome place for teenagers that are runaways or living on the streets. It gives them a place that they can crash and really help get their stuff together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 'Sup, Jewel-face?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Donate to the Vision.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes, I have Operation Supply Drop, which is a great charity service that delivers fun where there is none to soldiers that are in combat overseas. It delivers gaming systems, games, brings some much-needed levity to areas of high intensity and overall warrior badassmanship, and I'm very proud of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What a variety of charities.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, that's a good stretch of charities.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: My charity.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: Oh, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I got one too, guys!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. I sometimes forget about you, because you're on that side.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know, it happens.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're god!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, no, overlooked my entire life, it's nothing new. My charity is First Book, which brings reading materials to underprivileged children and helps people become more confident readers and youth that don't have access to programs to help promote literary adventure and really delving into the amazing thing that is reading. Thank you guys for helping us support that, it's been really fantastic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All things that are important for the future.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So important. More than you'd give it credit for. Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And of course, as always, Critical Role always supports 826LA.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, continually.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Continually. They are our sponsored charity of choice, and of course look up 826, there might be an 826 in your area. And you should go to their storefronts. They make great date locations, as Taliesin always says.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, great date.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, they really do, that is a really good place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Find a date. Take them there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Find the date first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Tell them Critical Role sent you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Wow, you took that to a dark place. You took that--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway. So. So. Let us go ahead and delve into tonight's game proper, folks. So, to get you up to speed, Vox Machina, the intrepid band of adventurers you see before you, after a series of adventures, had found their way back to their central city of Emon, in the center of the region of Tal'Dorei. After a ceremony in which the leader of their city, Sovereign Uriel Tal'Dorei, was announcing him stepping down, the town was suddenly under siege by a group of extremely powerful and dangerous ancient dragons that call themselves the Chroma Conclave. After tearing the city asunder in many places, three of them flew off into the east under the instruction of the fourth and possibly largest and leader of the group, that has recently been found to be called Thordak the Cinder King, who currently resides in the center of the city of Emon, claiming that his mercy is only for those who worship him and essentially feed his greed and hunger. As such, Vox Machina, narrowly escaping the battle, a couple of encounters with these dragons, including one above their Keep, are housing a number of survivors who have made their way out of the city and are currently residing in Greyskull Keep for protection. You guys went into the city to see if you could find any other allies and friends that may have survived this encounter. You befriended a member of the Clasp, named Garthok, who walked amongst the rubble and proceeded to show you the secret entrance he knows to the Clasp, of which you may be trying to inquire about information. On your way to that area, you passed by Gilmore's shop, Gilmore being a good friend of the group and a powerful magic practitioner and creator of magical items and artifacts and a number of glorious goods. His abode, however, smashed and currently a pile of burnt wood and rock. Looters were currently poring through, and you attempted to get them to leave the area alone. It came to blows, and with many of the looters falling in battle, two of which were kept locked away. You discovered the location of where they were hoarding the massive amounts of gold and artifacts that they had acquired from the rubble. You then found the secret compartment in which Gilmore's teleportation sigil was locked beneath his shop, where the remaining family of Tal'Dorei, Salda and the three children, as well as Gilmore himself, wounded and barely alive, having saved them. You found that Uriel, the Sovereign, did not seemingly survive the encounter with the dragons, and Gilmore nearly fell going back to try and make sure that you guys were okay, barely escaping with his life. You managed to save his, and taking the children, Salda, Sherri, and Gilmore back to Greyskull Keep, some of you splintered off to try and acquire the goods that were taken from his store, however, they apparently had already been stolen from the location they were being stored in, or been delivered already, you're uncertain as to what became of them, but you get the sense that it was probably best that you chose Gilmore over the gold at first glance. Making your way back to the Keep, you've sent Gilmore up to rest for the evening, some of you have then found your way down into the temple of Sarenrae, where a number of the escaped refugees from Emon currently try desperately to cling to their memories, to try and keep the shakes at bay and contemplate what the next step is for survival in this now partially ruined city. That was where we left off. So. What would you like to do?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kill all the dragons and save the day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good! Roll for it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that was a good roll. See?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Natural 20. No, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Good show, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled five natural 20s before the show even started.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a great, great idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So it's all going to be terrible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why are you rolling before the show?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She feels like she's got to "warm up" her endless army of dice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, I just have to figure out which ones I want to use that night.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You have five d20s right now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, and they're all useful. No, I've got six out here.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, definitely all useful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is, by the way, for anybody tuning in for the first time at home, this is how we express that we have no idea what to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where are we?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're at home.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're in Greyskull Keep.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And Gilmore's with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gilmore's with you, he's been brought upstairs--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And did Pike's holy visitor fix the keep, or is the keep still effed up?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, in the short time in which her visitor, this angelic deva-like entity that was brought forth from Sarenrae's sphere of influence, did manage to repair entirely the damage that was sustained to the Keep from the battle with Vorugal out in your courtyard. So yes, Greyskull Keep is now back to being intact and rather fairly polished. The stained glass is affixed and corrected.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It must look so strange next to the ruined city of Emon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's far enough away, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Little strange.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So what time is it? It was nighttime, right? Or was it midday?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about midafternoon at this point, maybe pushing into the evening.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is Kima still around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'm sorry, what was that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is Lady Kima still around, or?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Lady Kima's been in Vasselheim.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm on the wrong page.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she and Drake went.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember, they turned into shooting stars and they flew away.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is Clarota still here with us? (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're off to a good start tonight, guys.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: In your hearts. In your heart of hearts.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Where are the majority of the people? Are they in the dining hall and in the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're scattered between the dining hall and the temple to Sarenrae. Partially because, one, there's enough space there, two, it's a place of sanctity, it's a place of hope, and Pike is currently bringing people-- not preaching to them, per se, but offering comfort in their current area of misery and worry. So those are pretty much the localized areas. Occasionally one of the kids might begin wandering the halls, a parent might chase after them, trying to draw them back in, but respectfully, no one's wandering the house filling their pockets, they're all still happy to be alive at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, that's because we don't have anything, because Scanlan's troupe stole everything anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's that, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We bought new silverware.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure we did.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe it wasn't my troupe, maybe it was our new guests, the people fleeing for their lives.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was going to say, are there any new people that have come into the keep while we've been away? Can I ask one of our guards that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, yeah. Shayne, who's out front, currently strolling through the courtyard, comes up to you, and as you ask her, she goes, "Well, we've had a few other refugees come in and ask for "entry, and we patted them down to make sure there were no weapons and tried our best to keep an eye "on them since they arrived. Seems like most everyone's keeping either into the city or keeping "fairly underground."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody's sticking out to you, though, no shady individuals, nobody sweating more than is necessary when being threatened by a big fuck-off dragon?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not yet, but I believe Jarett's keeping a close eye."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jarett--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That guy. Man-crush?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wonder, in all prudence, should we go around to the 'fugees, the refugees and do a quick--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Insight check?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: -- scan, alignment check or something?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lauryn Hill is shaking her head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we have anything that can sense people's alignment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike might.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I can.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you do a mass, a mass sense alignment?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mass sense alignment?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that a thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm saying I could do some insight checks on people.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, I'm talking about your magic.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm not Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike's with us, though, right? She could do an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is she with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike is with you. She is currently helping folks inside the temple. But you could go ask her to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Use the skull to wish to know everyone's alignment. Problem solved.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll kill everyone. Kill everyone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should just kill one of them to make an example.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is terrible, what is happening?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This isn't the real game, the game hasn't actually started yet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Glancing about the populace of scattered refugees throughout the general vicinity of Greyskull Keep, I will pick two of you who wish to be the main surveyors of the crew.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this insight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This would be insight, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm on it with Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so Vex and Keyleth, both you guys roll insight checks, please.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Insight?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Both of you guys spend about ten, 15 minutes or so scanning through the crew, asking a few questions, helping a few folks out while keeping an eye on reactions around the general vicinity. No one sticks out to you as being either hiding their intent, shifty. There are a few folks that are aloof from the whole experience, who seem to be either in a state of shock, or discomfort based on their current surroundings, but nothing in a way that strikes you as nefarious or worrisome.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And are they all strangers, other than the people we brought back with us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Correct.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They are strangers?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. There's a lot of people that live in Emon, and none of them seem to catch your eye.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Is anyone still badly hurt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Most of them have had their wounds tended to. There are a few that have general scars, some from elements of frostbite on their skin, who were caught in the blast, who were salvaged after Vorugal left. There are a few that have scrapes and bruises from fleeing from the town, from collapsing debris from different buildings and such, but no serious injuries. A few bone fractures here and there that have been set and bandaged.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to spend the first bit of time at home helping Pike, doing whatever she tells me to do, really, to help the people here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is there any deceased that need to be tended to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, there are a number of deceased in the front courtyard, people that were frozen and shattered as part of Vorugal's attack, which at this point, most of them have been taken care of by the guards and given a proper burial on the outside of the Keep, a few yards away, towards the inside of the one of the hills. They haven't been left to thaw, if that was what you're worried about.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's what I was worried about.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Red meat. Red.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gross.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Way to go dark. Way to go dark.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought that's what we were doing today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cost-effective. A number of the refugees have also helped the guards as well, transporting the bodies of the deceased and making sure that they're properly interred in the nearby countryside.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are our options here? First of all, do we know Gilmore's status?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we need to get him settled in, make sure he's all right.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, he's gone up, he's resting.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we put him to bed already.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He's in Percival's room, I think. You said you would sleep in your laboratory.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And when we last left things, there was one plan to go into the tunnels of the thieves' guild and try to see if there's any more--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. Actually, Garthok.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garthok is waiting for us down in those, so we can go look at the Clasp and talk to them and everything, because he's told them we're on our way.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And to what end, again? We're going to see if there's any random diplomats left over?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're the only functioning organization left in the city at this point.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's true, they're a double-edged sword, though. I mean, they should not be trusted, we cannot trust them, but they are an infrastructure under the city. They may have more of an idea what's going on than we do. I'm the best to speak to them, but I'm not on good terms with them, and I've never really talked to you about this, but you were marked at one point, a long time ago.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: For death?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Actually, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why? What did I do?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm sure I don't know. The reason there is a brand on my back is because I interceded. Some other schmoe died instead of you. You might be a bit of a sore point with them. I don't know. They might not remember, but I don't think that's true, I think they'll remember.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long ago was this?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did you do?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So many things.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Before we met, when Vex and I were on our own.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Was it because you farted that time?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You didn't think you could mention this? All the times we've dealt with the Clasp? You didn't think it was worth mentioning that I almost died?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She's already been down there. She's already been down there! You think they're going to recognize her now?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're going down to talk.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We've been down there to talk.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Right. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's why you don't keep secrets.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've all had a moment, probably within the last three weeks. I'm not saying I don't.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I haven't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, oddly, you and Pike seem to be immune.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It is a virtue.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But let's organize a group, and let's at least open relations with them at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, hang on, hang on. What are we going to say to them when we get down there? What are we going to offer them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They don't want a city ruled by a dragon, we don't want a city ruled by a dragon. It's in their interest to help us clear the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They're going to look out for themselves, and you're probably-- I'm sure you're right, they want these dragons out, but they will do-- they will preserve their own existence, and there's a possibility that bowing before these beasts will preserve their existence.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Not long-term, and these are groups that think long-term.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry, there were levels.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And yes, we've been down there, we've argued with them, but we're talking about going down there and making an alliance, an ongoing alliance, and shit might come up, that's all I'm saying.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's make it a business deal. We're talking about making a political decision. This is politics.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if they leave? What if they leave the city, or what if they turn us in to the dragon to save their own asses?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They could. I doubt they'd leave, that's a terrible waste of an investment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You're essentially relying on the underbelly of Emon to restore it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am, I'm relying on greed, it tends to be exceedingly reliable.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: In your experience.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In all experience, let's be honest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Said the greedy one to the greedy one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is one option, are we sure we don't want to seek help--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, what are our other options?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm curious as to other options.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We know why the dragons are here, right? Ish?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really feel like it might be necessary for me to also reach out to the Air and Earth and possibly even the Water Ashari. It might be difficult because I haven't been there yet. To see if they've had any other tears through the other elemental planes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be quite wise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We can also seek to employ their services.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What about you becoming a spy?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been thinking about that, long and hard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What are your thoughts?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Most of what I do is long and hard. And my thoughts are still: fuck you, no way, fuck off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: So what you're saying is?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So you're saying there's a chance.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Your shining moment--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing is ever going to top the triceratops, really.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe the triceratops could kill all the dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All right. So we reach out to the Ashari.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How's your homeland?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to find out?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would love to.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can transport there instantly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can. I just can't get back instantly.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You need Keyleth.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And I figure that they would have sent somebody at this point if things had gone-- they have an instant transport to us if they need to find us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: True.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Unless they don't know about the stone and the only one with the stone--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Council knows about the stone.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Or there's no one left to send.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes, if things went south--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We would've heard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can scry twice today.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That would be lovely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can do it two times. So we need to pick where it's most important to check in versus where we might want to pop in and say hello.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whitestone is also somewhere we could arm ourselves more completely against something like this. We're going to have to start--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: With what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As a note, too, Pike can also scry as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, good. Because I would like to check in to Vasselheim as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do you kill a dragon? Do we need a dragon? Can we get a dragon that hates these dragons? Is that a thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You know, there is the Slayer's Take.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait, what are we talking about dragons? Do other dragons hate dragons?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, could we find a dragon who could fight for us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, there's metallic dragons.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Don't get along with chromatic.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we know any metallic dragons?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, where are they?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We would have to go to Vasselheim and maybe--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: My Aunt Edna.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: She's a dragon-lady, I don't know if that's the same thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like, oh, like she-- little ceramic dragons, she likes collecting them?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was mocking him, yes.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So, wait, the Slayer's Take, what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, it's an organization made to hunt massive creatures, isn't it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a horde of fucking ass-kickers, is what it is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We fought a dragon-- we killed a dragon for them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're also rooted in Vasselheim, which is--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, but-- If everything else is under attack, Vasselheim is inevitable.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, but they're protected.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: For a time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Allow me to play tiefling's advocate. If we leave now and allow the Clasp to take hold and form some sort of new shadow government, without us having any part in it, it's out of our control completely. It won't be in our control at all. But maybe if we speak to them now, we'll have a better idea of what's going on. I'm not sold on any idea yet, but if we leave now and let things play out, it's entirely out of our hands.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, well, how about this? We can scry, between Pike and I, four times. So we can make four phone calls today.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not phone calls, just a look.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, look home. No, we can peek through a window. And we can try and go visit the Clasp.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, well, let's scry it up, then. Who are we calling? Whitestone, Vasselheim, center of Emon?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Definitely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I want to check in with--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I object to checking the center of Emon, right? Because that's where the Cinder King is?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't it, like, ruin magic when we did it to the beholder, didn't it see us and laugh and we were like, augh, it hurts my brain--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's got a point. You've got a point.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're pretty smart, Grog.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We don't need to scry into Emon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I remember.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And you can do it another two--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You know what, let's go talk to Pike, because Pike might possibly have some sort of spiritual connection with Vasselheim as well that might save us a scry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's possible that Vasselheim might be our next stop after we secure everything here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, Pike! Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can also teleport us once today, if we decide to go anywhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pike! Pikey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Comes out, a little bit of dirt on her brow, looks like she's been busy handling some of the folks--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I reach out and brush the dirt from above her forehead.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She smiles and pushes your hand away. "Yes, what, yes?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pike, do you have any sort of spiritual connection with Vasselheim? Do you feel-- you know how--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I do. I do. Why?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, can you check--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you scry?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you see if they're okay? We want to scry and check in with a few places.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Of course, of course, no worries." She ushers you guys back into the temple.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Untouched from the dragon's scourge, at the very "least." MARISHA & LAURA: That's good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What of Whitestone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Focuses for a second. Spends a few more moments in her scrying ritual before stepping back, and turns slowly to you, Percy, and says, "Whitestone seems fairly overlooked by these dragons as well. The "town rebuilds. People seem to be going about their lives. Possibly none the wiser as to what's "transpired this side of Tal'Dorei."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll send word, at the very least.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's all over the water. Maybe the dragons haven't gone that far.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's far north. I'll make sure to send word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay." One of the kids starts crying, and she goes, "Oh, hold on." And goes over and starts tending to one of the children who has like a knee brace on, and is currently aching, and she goes to help calm him down. "Shh, shh."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do you think you could look in on Syngorn?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Of course.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mostly to see, you know.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I step up to the table, and begin my scrying ritual, checking on Syngorn first.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need like cups and string or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We do. Or a walkie-talkie. He's saying, Syngorn is gone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't say that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Millions dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Millions. It's very large.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, he didn't even get a new franchise before it was--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For all your reclaimed wood needs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Well done. Well done. That was nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The best was watching Laura go, "Oh what a great i-- ooh."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And endless supply of pavers and gravel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All your home improvements.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Back to your regularly scheduled D&D game.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What did you see, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Lie.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lay. Did it look like it was destroyed to nothing? Or transported somewhere?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Like that. Like transported, like the city was lifted out of its place and was teleported elsewhere.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could it have been-- I don't know how your scrying works-- could it have been some sort of a magical block? Not real, an illusion of some sort?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would like Vax and Vex to both roll a history check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Any kind of advantage on that? For growing up there or something?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, that's-- you get to roll this because of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: History?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should have stayed in school.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Didn't help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I take a roll just for being a nerd?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All out of luck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Are you proficient in history?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am proficient in history.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure, I'll let you roll.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I want a nerd roll. 24. Book reading!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Being the astute researcher, the indoor kid growing up. Yeah. There aren't a lot of books that made their way north about pure elven culture, especially wooded elves, that comprise the entirety of the Syngorn nation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It has rarely come into play, but because of previous wars, terrible devastation, and the need for the elvish culture to protect itself, and to maintain its existence, you do know that there have been instances of large enchantments on places of cultural importance that would bridge between here and the Feywild. And as a defense mechanism, essentially, would cloak and/or shift those locations.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They've gone into hiding.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How can you be sure?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't, but there's reason to believe so. It's what it points to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What points to what? What are you talking about?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Historically, elves have, in times of great stress, taken important sites, important places, people, and either cloaked them, hidden them, or moved them into the Feywild until such time as the danger has passed. There is precedence for this. They've gone into hiding.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's one more thing our father failed to impart to us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughs cynically) At least he's safe.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Most likely.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I need to check in on the Air Ashari. I'm going to spend my last scrying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. As your vision separates from your current place of origin, you find yourself drifting up into the clouds and speeding through the air. The location itself is blurred, though recalling the origin of where you originally came from, you pass by columns of black smoke to your left, you assume somewhere related to Westrunn's current location.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Eventually, the clouds part, and you find yourself thrust down upon the earth amongst the center of the Air Ashari tribe. You can see the thin leather constructs that make up a portion of your people's hovels and buildings. You can see the nearby chasm-based windfall that pours through constantly with a gentle whistling sound that forever is marked as the chorus that guides you all to sleep every evening. There, you can see your people amongst various conversations, going amongst their various daily duties, seemingly untouched, unscathed, and unaware of what recent events had transpired.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They're okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is the last of your scrying capability for the day.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You didn't have to know that. Big girls don't scry. Sorry, I saw it on Netflix.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow. Wow. Hit after hit after hit today, Taliesin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You know, just because you can, doesn't mean you should.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I know. I know. Coffee hasn't kicked in yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, they're okay. They seem unaware, which is very disheartening on a few levels.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, they'll know soon enough.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are going to need transport.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To where?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ah. I don't think we're going to win this fight staying here, I think we're going to have to rally power, I think we're going to have to rally allies. I don't think there's enough here for us to win.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we relocate all of the refugees staying in our walls? Can we bring everyone through the Sun Tree? Keyleth? How long does it stay open?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Six seconds.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can go in shifts. This is not something that's going to be solved tomorrow. We can take a week, and move people.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's true. And there's 50 to 100 refugees, you said, something like that, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now, in your keep, surviving, you're looking at the 30s.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But there's hundreds more inside the city walls. Thousands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going-- we're not going to be able to empty the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we can at least get these people out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can get these people out. And we're going to need-- and I apologise for the brightness in my voice-- I think we're going to need an airship.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: An airship sounds wonderful, Percy, but--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You mean like the one that crashed?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like the one that crashed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One dragon attacking it and it's down.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to need to move quickly, though, from city to city, and we're going to need to get word.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, moving quickly from city to city-- I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We may have to steal an airship or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to steal a plane?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm making a plan. I'm thinking of a plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You keep thinking, there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's working.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I mean, I've recently discovered that that misty Wind Walk spell that I cast on all of us is not great for battle, but is great for travel. And that lasts for eight hours.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What does? Who?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Remember how I failed and almost killed us all?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Shit the bed. Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Thanks, Grog. What I learned out of that was it's not great for battle, but it is great for travel. It lasts for eight hours. We can move 300 feet per second.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wonderful. We get the refugees out, we go to Whitestone, we talk to them there, we use the Misty Walk thingy and go to Vasselheim, talk to the Slayer's Take. This is perfect. Problem--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just throwing that out there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There is an empty airdock that's currently not being used in the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we need a ship right now, darling? I understand the joy in it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't need it now, but we're going to be-- need to move--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't you understand? We would be helping humanity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm with Vex. You all honestly--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: -- believe a dragon wouldn't notice a giant airship flying out of the city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not if we hide it with some-- some smokescreen action of some sort.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We need to talk to the Clasp first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, let's go talk to the Clasp. We'll ask them what they think about--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus Allura and Drake are coming back. We need to talk to them as well. Find out what's going on in Westrunn. And then we need to get everyone out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can transport some of us via plants today. I will have to sleep if we want and study to do the Misty Step again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've got a plan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have time. This is not a one-day plan.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Here's a good plan. This is a good plan, though.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Here it comes, everybody.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Open up the tree. Send a bunch of refugees through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shove a bunch in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy. You go with them. We keep the stone. You go through. You talk to your sister. You bamf back with the stone.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Because they're going to freak out if like--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then we talk to the Clasp together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think that's a good plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They will freak out if 20 refugees pour out of the Sun Tree. And they have no context.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do that first.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay. So wait, are you going to go on your mission while we go talk to the Clasp?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we're going to wait for you. So can we get the refugees together?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, so as you go into the temple and get Pike's attention, you begin to round up the refugees, which as a statement, historically, is already unnerving. You begin to push them all together in a group and tell them what?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, we comfort them and tell them: all right, obviously Emon is not a safe place to be right now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, that's true, that's true! It's terrible here!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's dangerous, and we want to keep all of you as safe as possible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, and thank you for taking us." Everyone starts cheering.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We have a plan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We probably can only take a few. It should be women and children.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to take those of you who need the most attention first, and we're going to bring you to Whitestone, which is a city that has not been affected by dragons at all. It has much need of people who can do an honest day's labor, and you can earn a wage and find a living there, for the time being, and if at some point in time you want to come back to Emon when all of this is done, of course you're more than welcome to.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There is opportunity.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And no dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a persuasion check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm rolling the gold one! 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay! A couple of folks currently, (muttering) "I've never been to Whitestone! Is it cold?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the winter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's winter!"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then it could be a little chilly!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Bundle up! We'll give you some wool blankets for the trip!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There's definitely no vampires there. None.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A couple of kids go, "Vampires, sir?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I like that we're sending to them to the place that's got the orb of death.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What was that? What'd you say?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, nothing, she didn't say anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I said, "You might be able to see your breath!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Winter! Right! Okay, let's grab our things!" And some of the folks start getting their things together. Packing up their things-- what they had on their back, essentially, as they rushed here. Shake a few out of their shell-shock, and they all gather up towards the center of the Temple of Sarenrae.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Percy-- stone. To go through the--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I already gave it to Keyleth.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: DM question? How many do you think I can fit through in six seconds?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll find out!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If I put them in like a line, and we're like, "Go! Go! Go!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's up to you guys! How do you want to do this?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They can't get-- no one can get cut in half, can they?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well I assume, as soon as we see it start to shrink, we stop! We cut off the line.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, what we should do-- here's the thing that I'm worried about. We don't want, like, a kid to go through, and then they get separated from their mom.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, everybody's got to grow up at some point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anybody with children. How many children are here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say you have seven children.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Children with their moms go-- and families go first.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we were saying that the terribly injured, the people with the worst injuries--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right, those people first!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, those people first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, because they'll go through real fast.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And then with kids-- But they need attention now! They need--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey! We're going to be doing this every day for several days.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Hey, I've got a weird theory. Let's not send people with injuries yet, so that perhaps Pike can stay here and take care of them for a little bit?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Good call, okay! So the injured can stay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can't we put them on a wagon? Can't we like put them on a wagon, down and like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't want to lose a wagon to Whitestone.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is just how Schindler did it, by the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What!?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He debated it for a while, and then-- (nervous laughter).

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No words! No words!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the room goes silent, and the mug comes up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Families first. How about that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll count to six, and then we'll put the rope down, and when we hit six, we pull the rope, and it'll hold everybody--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, there's a rope?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As soon as we see it start to shrink, I'll hold the people back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, hold the people back.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So Percy, you're first, everybody follow through. So any families here? Families?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some of the kids raise their hands, some adults go over and they grab kids' hands and stand next to them. "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you really respons-- I can tell when you're lying, sir. Are you responsible for that child?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ha! Two of those people are definitely just taking a kid's hand in hopes of getting through first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I walk in and start cracking my knuckles behind Vex.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I mean, I can wait, no worries! Eh--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Child, where's your parents? Do you have one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They haven't shown up yet."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, dear.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Leave them here, in case the parents come.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. Then you would stay and wait for your family, potentially?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can stay with Pike, for now.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pike comes over and pats him on the shoulder. They're the same height, so it's easy.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do completed full families who are comfortable relocating.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That can move. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Altogether, completed full families, there are two.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How many people?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'd be a total of eight people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's good! That's a good amount!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, think about it! One one thousand, one one thousand--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And then, any other like single people that can move fast?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, a couple single people? To bring up the rear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You have about ten more people that raise their hands.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can get that many through in six seconds.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get ready to run, people.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, you're going to lead. Percy, you're going to lead. We're going to put the eight up front, with the ten, 15 stragglers behind. I tell them all: all right. As soon as you see that tree start to part, run! Run your face off! I tell that to the crowd.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a thing I've been working on, it's going to be great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Don't stop in the tree, you will create terrible congestion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Everybody comfortable with the plan?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can I inspire Keyleth for this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, I will perform a limerick for her to inspire her. I know an airheaded young druid / whose plans are more gassy than fluid / when the battle starts / she turns her pals into farts / they see danger and pass right through it!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thank you, Scanlan. I love it. It's so like me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Take a 1d10 inspiration die.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I hate to be the detail-oriented one about this whole thing, but should somebody be counting as soon as she starts so we put down an arm at six?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You count in your head, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You really don't want me to do that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe with my inspiration, I can get a few more seconds in there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We shall see. I'll say for the sake of this, go ahead and roll a wisdom check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh boy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A d20 and add your wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, that's not good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've got inspiration if you need it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I add my inspiration to this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good. That helps a lot. What am I adding? Just my straight wisdom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep, wisdom modifier.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My modifier? 19 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19 total, okay. So as you all gather around in the center of the temple, Keyleth, you step up to the outside of one of the two front trees to the temple, one of the ones you guys usually use to transport to and from here. As you focus in and reach your hand out and touch the outside of the tree's bark, with a rough tearing sound, the tree bark widens into an oval-shaped doorway that is immediately visible. On the opposite side, you can see before you a lightly snow-dappled landscape that is the central market of Whitestone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We put blankets on everybody, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From what you had.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Go! Go! Now, run, go! Go, Percy, go!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's pushing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm already through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy's through. All right, are you guys just letting them go at their own rate?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (shouting) Move your fucking asses!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll an intimidation check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a football line.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. With that, everyone goes, (startled noise) and starts charging through wildly. The crowd starts pushing through.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm trying to hold it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No severed limbs, no whammies!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some folks who weren't even planning to go on this were so driven by the sudden shouting Grog voice echoing from behind that they charged forward Black Friday-style, and managed to escape the tail end of the spell tapering the doorway off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "I regret nothing!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I hope Percy comes back soon.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've got the gatestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Percy?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everyone, please follow me. We're heading towards the main castle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're all looking around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Welcome to Whitestone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hey! Percival." (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you for that smattering of applause. Golf claps, please. Golf claps.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The refugees all gather up behind you, and you guys walk towards Castle Whitestone.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We make our way to the castle.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And within a few minutes, Cassandra comes down from the upper floor. "Percival, you've returned."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Things are not going well. Have you heard any news of Emon and what has been transpiring there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, we've been focused on restoring our city. Why?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There's no simple way to say this, but we're under siege. We were afraid that Whitestone would be destroyed, as well, but it seems that they have passed over you so far, but we fear for many cities' safety. I was hoping that it would be all right if we moved a small number of refugees through to Whitestone for the time being. Less than a hundred, I imagine. These are the first 20-some-odd that we've pulled through.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And she looks behind you, looks to the crowd, snaps her fingers. Some of the guards step forward, she goes, "Please, if you would make sure to find any of the various unoccupied buildings are provided to these "refugees. Thank you." And the guards nod, and begin gathering the group and sending them back into town, and she gives you a look back and says, "For better or for worse, we happen to have a number of vacancies in the city due to recent "events. But--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh! Well, yes. Nothing I-- Anything I should know about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, just-- We've lost many in the struggle against the Briarwoods. But yes, they will be "provided for, I assure you."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So I will let you know to stop all business with Emon for now. Be very wary, prepare the city for a possible dragon attack. Things are looking dark.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, yes."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if it's possible, any research-- any energy that can be put forward towards mounting some sort of defense against these creatures would be greatly appreciated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right, right, well, we had a few individuals that were researching the ziggurat "beneath the city. Two left a while back and we had one arrive just the other day."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who arrived the other day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I cannot recall his name-- Realm Seeker, Realm Seer-- I'm not--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) Eskil Ryndarien!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Please bring me to him.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, Cassandra leads you down into the city again, and one of the houses has been provided, she knocks on the door, the door opens and you see stepping out, an older gentleman who you've heard of but not really had an encounter with since-- no, actually you encountered him for the final ritual that took the phylactery from Grog's chest.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh my god.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But this is Realmseer Eskil Ryndarien, the archmage that basically was one of the folks who lived within Westruun and was called to Whitestone as part of research--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's some pre-stream stuff, everybody.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As the door opens, he comes out, eyes adjusting to the light, and you can see the interior is very dark. He's one of those live-in-lightless-territory types of person. Comes out with his round spectacles around his nose, his robe is disheveled, bundled over his shoulders, he goes, "Yes, if I may be of service--?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We've met! You look very familiar.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Quite! Yes we have. You're with those S.H.I.T.s, weren't you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughing) Ah, yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Unfortunate title you've chosen--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Long gone, thankfully, long gone. We're Vox Machina--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good! Vox Machina, glad you took my suggestion."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (laughing)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What can I do for you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, first of all, how goes the research into the--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Frustrating, to say the least. It appears that this entire--" and he walks back into the house, expecting you guys to follow. As you enter, immediately you're hit with the smell of sage and other burning herbs, and you can see there's a vast number of books that are strewn about the table in front. The fireplace in the back is pouring smoke up into the roof area and soot's starting to gather on the stonework on the outside. Looks like there's two or three different kettles going off with different types of tea. It's complete chaos in here, but he seems to be in control of most of it, at least. He goes, "From best we can ascertain, this is some sort of a magical siphon "device. It has prevented us from utilizing any sort of ritualistic endeavors in ascertaining its "nature, it's quite perplexing. I'm hoping to either head over to Wildemount, or perhaps return "to the Cobalt Reserve and perhaps find some historical information about such an object, but "nothing in my current--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I hail from Emon, which has been attacked by chromatic dragons--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry, what?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Dragons have declared war on civilization. A group of dragons have destroyed our city, and they have destroyed other cities as well. We are in desperate need of powers to defend ourselves with-- So I would be very careful and send forward-- Send word ahead of yourself before you travel anywhere, it may not be there by the time you get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I guess it's good that I moved my tower before I left."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Things are looking grim and I would ask while you-- If you intend to remain and work on your research on this anomaly beneath our city, perhaps thinking as to how it may be turned into a weapon for our use against these creatures would not be out of the realm of question, and any information you do have of the chromatic dragons would be invaluable. Any research that can be done. We are at war.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "This is very disconcerting news. I will do what I can. Unfortunately, I'd have to get back to "the Cobalt Reserve. That's where most of my research is completed."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, my lord?" "If you would be so kind, prepare me for travel, pack up this--"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Westruun is no more, sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, that's really frustrating!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Really."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Extremely aggravating.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes. I am unhappy with this circumstance! How am I supposed to do my research without a "place to do my research?!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, we hope that you will find our winters here quite solitary, and convenient on that level. Things are looking grim.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, you can say that again."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I must go. I have other work to do to start preparing--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Peace!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, yes go! Do your thing!"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Good day, sir. And good luck to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Should I find anything, how will I-- whereabouts-- Where are you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't know yet, but we will be returning here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That does not help me. I will do my best."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Cassandra will be able to get a hold of me if necessary.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Ah, Cassandra. All right! Someone of use around here."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I am going to go find my sister and make my way to the stone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't even say goodbye to you. He's completely flustered. It's funny. For everyone who's taken completely by the horror of the situation, he just seems really perturbed about the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Inconvenience of it all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, it's so inconvenient. That library was very helpful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why isn't the internet working! (frustrated noise)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Basically. You find your way to Cassandra again. She's waiting outside of the room. "I hope "he's been helpful, brother"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, he wasn't helpful, but it was very helpful the way he wasn't helpful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a strange, strange--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's a very strange man."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everything's going to be all right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hope so."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. I will return very soon. We will, again with your permission, hopefully be using Whitestone as a place to regroup and prepare ourselves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Is there worry that these dragons might come here?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How will we stop them?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You'll hide. I have thoughts, perhaps of a weapon. I don't know. But we're going to find a way to stop them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "We have to."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm not good at being the bearer of any bad news, but this is very dangerous and I don't know what we're going to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (whispers) Steal an airplane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Neither do I."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (whispers) They don't have an airplane.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Stay safe, Percival."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I shall return soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I hope so. We'll do what we can in the meantime to see to your refugees and hopefully try "and prepare ourselves."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There will be a few more through, possibly tomorrow, with word.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "All right. We'll be prepared. Thank you." She reaches out and puts her hand on yours, again, and looks you sternly in the face and goes, "Be careful."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I will.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're all I have left."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And Cassandra, I'm proud of you. You're doing very well here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There's still a ways to go, brother."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll get there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She hands you the gatestone. And with that, there's a slight popping sound as you're in a very soft bit of bluish-purple light. Your body slowly subsides and fades into nothing before it (poof) vanishes out of existence. As you guys are back at the keep, suddenly, who has the gatestone? As you're holding it, it begins to shake in your hand and give off a warm light.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think our reservation's ready.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm telling the, what, seven remaining refugees?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have about eight or nine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry you didn't make it through. It doesn't mean that you'll be here forever. We'll get you there tomorrow. No big. Don't worry about it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: More food for you guys, which is A+.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At which point now, there's a slight smell of burnt cedar before the air itself begins to sound like a light hum or vibration as suddenly Percy's form (poof) appears in the center of the room next to your gatestone. Both of the stones you guys are holding all of a sudden become white-hot, and you instinctively drop them before they tumble to the ground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey! They work!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They hurt. Good to know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's great. Did you see your sister?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did, everything is fine up there, the research continues. They're happy to take people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's wonderful.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're also happy to be a base of operations as we put things together.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And you told them to make preparations in case something happens?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (sighs) For now.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: In the worst-case scenario they can go underground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Worst-case scenario, they can go underground, yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They need to start hiding food.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They have to grow food, they haven't really recovered that yet. There's also a--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hopefully I hooked them up there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have one of those terrible ideas I get on occasion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is it? I love it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That thing beneath Whitestone could be a weapon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, that's true.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Anything touching it disintegrates.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! Like a dragon.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you shoot it at something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I might be able to turn it into a projectile.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How would you turn it to a projectile-- are you okay, Keyleth?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It is a fun idea--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A long-term idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just choking on Percy's idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can make an antimagic missile.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What-- a magic-- a magic missile? An antimagic missile?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: An antimagic missile.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One plus one plus two plus one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One plus two plus one plus one!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a great idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've been-- I've been mulling it over.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Could we fire it from an airship of some sort?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes, I have-- that's actually part of the idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Percy, when I tried to touch that thing it was like it was sucking me in. I don't think that thing and me touched. How are we going to turn it into a projectile?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have thoughts, I'm going to follow them through, and it may require some experimentation in the future, but I think perhaps--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: At the cost of possibly your life?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take my life into my hands any time I build something. I think that a non-magical approach to containing it might actually work. I think the problem is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well that's good, because it cancels out any magic--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think the problem is that we keep trying to magic our way out of something that denies magic, and maybe I can engineer our way out of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Have they found anything out, did you get any updates?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: A little bit of information, there will be more later. I'm going to take a look at all the data and see if it's possible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we go visit the Clasp?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm trying to be more open.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's go!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this time? It's pretty close to dusk, the sun is getting close to the mountain line, you probably have another hour of daylight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: To the Clasp?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That means they're around at night.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're not turtles, no.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you learn something new, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, you guys heading back into Emon?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Everyone? Some? All?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think Pike should stay behind to take care for--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: You seem to have reservations--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vex, are you okay going down there? You're marked for death by these people.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I've been down there several times without knowing that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, I feel like it might put you on edge.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: She's not marked for death, she was marked for death, it's just awkward. It's awkward. I'm not a full-fledged member, they don't like me. I don't like them!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe I can become a member.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe you can.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is politics, you're not supposed to like them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, let's go, then.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah! What he said.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys taking the tunnel or you walking in?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Taking the tunnel, we're taking the secret entrance--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh come on, we're never even-- we've not even walked in yet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Garthok showed us the secret entrance, he's waiting for us and having them prepare our way, this could get bad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, are you guys walking through your tunnel to the city, is what I'm saying.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! That! Yes. Cool.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're not going to walk in the open.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are we doing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're taking our secret tunnel into the city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. It puts us in the wrong side of the city, but it's okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What else are we going to do?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (coughing)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How you doing there? You okay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm good. Mm-hmm. Sorry. I got a piece of chip stuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, I'm going to leave one with Vax.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm giving Vax my gatestone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a good idea.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm giving you the other one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For now, it's a good idea, I won't hold onto it forever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's the one who's going to get stuck in a room alone if they decide they don't like him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can we call this the Jenga stone? In moments of need.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jenga stone. Remember, it takes about a minute to work.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I need to spend a little time with this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No. However, it does work only once a day.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Once a day?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: After another long rest you'd be able to use it again.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: All right. Good to know. All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Into the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In your pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Like you do. Half-elven storage space. You guys find your way back into Emon, utilizing your secret tunnel entrance, coming up through the false outhouse once again. You leave the chain behind, locking it up, and make your way into the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cast Pass Without a Trace on us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys, I'd like you all to make a stealth check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, it fell out of my hand. I don't think it should count if it fell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope, too bad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, that's mean. Oh, I get advantage!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, and we get a plus ten, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: LAURA 35.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait. With no judgment, is Trinket coming?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Trinket is staying with Pike.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's a fine decision.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
